text: The George Washington Inaugural Bible is the Bible that was sworn upon by George Washington when he took office as the first President of the United States on April 30, 1789. The Bible is the King James Version from 1767.St. John's Lodge No. 1 George Washington Inaugural Bible information St. John's Lodge No. 1, Ancient York Masons, own the bible. Some people believe the Bible was randomly opened to Genesis 49 during the ceremony, although some experts believe Washington purposely chose it.Ceresi, Frank and McMains, Carol National Treasures - The George Washington Inaugural Bible The Bible has since been used for the inaugurations of Warren G. Harding in 1921, Dwight D. Eisenhower in 1953, Jimmy Carter in 1977, and George H. W. Bush in 1989. ==References== Category:George Washington Category:Bibles
title: George Washington Inaugural Bible
